summary: The Arleigh Burke class is a group of powerful U.S. Navy warships named after a famous World War II admiral. These destroyers are huge, measuring up to 509 feet long and weighing up to 9,700 tons. They carry over 90 missiles and can do many jobs, like fighting planes, submarines, and even land targets. They also protect against ballistic missiles and satellites. The first ship of this class was launched in 1991, and they are still being built today, making them the longest-running type of U.S. Navy surface ship.
title: Arleigh Burke-class destroyer
